Text: Tayside resident, who had recently travelled from northern Italy, becomes first confirmed COVID case in Scotland.

A four nations Action Plan to tackle the virus was agreed. Patients presenting with a history and symptoms suggestive of coronavirus to be isolated and infection control measures put in place until tests are confirmed.
The number of confirmed COVID cases in Scotland reached 11.
Cases had more than doubled again to 23 cases out of 2,101 tests conducted.
First case of community transmission which wasn't linked to travel or confirmed cases. Government says they are still in the 'containment phase'.
Anyone with a "new, continuous" cough or high temperature is now advised to self-isolate for seven days, as the UK government moved to the "delay" phase of its plan to tackle coronavirus.
The first death of a patient after contracting coronavirus in Scotland confirmed by authorities

In Scotland all large gatherings above 500 people should be cancelled to prioritise the Covid-19 outbreak. At a UK level, Boris Johnson advises people to work from home and avoid contact and travel where possible.

Scottish Government tells businesses including cafes, pubs, and restaurants to close, along with nightclubs, theatres, cinemas, gyms and leisure centres. Takeaway services can continue but customers cannot sit-in.
With the UK death toll hitting 335 deaths and 14 in Scotland, Boris Johnson announced a nationwide 'Stay at Home' order would come into effect as of midnight and it would be reviewed every 3 weeks.
The Scottish Parliament closes, with plans to reconvene on 1 April to discuss emergency legislation. 16 patients with confirmed cases of COVID-19 had died.
FM announces creation of new Scottish Government COVID-19 Advisory Group to supplement the advice it receives from SAGE.
Alister Jack, the Secretary of State for Scotland, announces that he is self-isolating after experiencing coronavirus symptoms

Header: 2000 Cases and NHS Louisa Jordan build begins
Text: Confirmed cases pass 2,000. The Scottish Government announces 3,500 tests a day by the end of the month and construction starts at the SEC in Glasgow to become a 300-bed capacity hospital.
Catherine Calderwood, Scotland's chief medical officer, resigns from her post after it emerged she had been spoken to by police for visiting her second home during lockdown.
The Coronavirus (Scotland) Act 2020, introduced as an Emergency Bill in the Scottish Parliament on 31 March, gains Royal Assent, becoming law.
After reviewing the lockdown with all nations in the UK, the decision is made to extend it for another three weeks until the 7 May.
NHS Louisa Jordan in Glasgow opens as confirmed cases pass 8,400 with 915 fatalities in hospitals.

The National Records of Scotland releases data on all deaths where coronavirus was believed to have been present, rather than just confirmed cases. Deaths in Scotland were 80% above the 5-year average.
Scottish Government publishes a strategy for ending lockdown, saying the lifting of restrictions in Scotland is "likely to be phased" with some measures remaining in place until 2021 "and beyond".
The Scottish Government recommends people cover their faces while in some public places such as shops and on public transport.
The public are made aware of an early Edinburgh Covid outbreak back in February 2020 at a Nike conference by an edition of the documentary series BBC Disclosure.
Anyone aged 5 or over, presenting symptoms of COVID-19, becomes eligible to get tested, while Anosmia is added to the COVID-19 symptom list.
More information about the Nike conference comes out showing that none of the people the Nike delegates were in contact with were approached for testing or support.

Header: Conference attendee was patient 0 for NE outbreak
Text: The Nike conference is proven to have started the outbreak in the North-East of England, as one of the delegates was infected and went to a birthday party and infected more people.

Header: Scottish Minister resigns in Cummings protest
Text: Douglas Ross resigns as a junior minister over the UK government's defence of Dominic Cummings, while at least 35 Conservative MPs call for Cummings to be removed from his post.
It is reported that 10 Nike delegates from the conference were taken for a kilt fitting, during which a woman fitting the kilts was infected by them.
